page.title: 09SOCIAL LIFE
page.content: CHARLTON AND MARGROVE PARK BOTH HAVE A VILLAGE HALL WHICH IS USED FOR BINGO, YOUTH CLUBS, WHIST DRIVES, OVER 40'S CLUB, MOTHER AND TODDLER GROUPS, VOCATIONAL CLASSES AND MEETINGS OF COMMITTEES. AT CHARLTON A FULL TIME WORKER IS EMPLOYED TO ORGANIZE EVENTS. THERE IS AN ANNUAL CARNIVAL, FELL RACE AND DEMONSTRATION DAY AT CHARLTON. STANGHOW'S COMMUNITY HALL IS LITTLE USED APART FROM AN ANNUAL CHRISTMAS PARTY FOR THE CHILDREN. AYSDALE GATE AND SLAPEWATH JOIN IN ACTIVITIES WITH THE OTHER COMMUNITIES.AT THE PUBLIC HOUSE AT SLAPWATH THE CLEVELAND HUNT MEETS. THE CHILDREN HAVE THE USE OF PLAY AREAS AT MARGROVE AND CHARLTON WITH SWINGS AND OTHER PLAY EQUIPMENT AND THERE IS A BMX TRACK AT MARGROVE PARK.
